<Author>Monteith1
<Content>Best by far!!! My fiance and I got engaged in New York last September and stayed at a different hotel over in Murray Hill which was great if a little old. However, we were coming back to the city (to buy wedding rings this time!) and we wanted to stay somewhere different, so I checked out the Sofitel, was very impressed with the reviews on this site and booked it.We stayed there from 5-8th March and it was simply the best hotel that either myself or my fiance had ever stayed in (and we've stayed in A LOT of hotels!). There is no way that this is a 4 star hotel - its 5 star all the way, from the impressive lobby, to the courteous staff, to the fantastic bedrooms.I was totally thrilled from the minute we walked in, we requested a room with a view and were given a room on 21st floor - no problem, the bathroom was absolutely fabulous, the room spacious and spotless. We even had the maid come in again at night to turn down our bed, and leave a bottle of mineral water with the weather forecast for the next day!I can't rate this hotel enough, its in a great location between 5th and 6th Avenues, 2 blocks from Times Square and close to many great attractions and stores. Definitely sign up for the Sofitel Privelege card, worth it for the late check out alone. Also the restaurant in the hotel (Gaby's) is top class and well worth a visit.We would not stay anyway else in New York now!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Hotel My fiance and I stayed at the Sofitel for 5 nights from 21st February 2005 to the 26th February 2005. We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Our trip was to celebrate my 30th birthday and my partner had spoken to the manager and asked for an upgrade. Not only did we get an upgrade with views of the Empire State Building but a bottle of champagne and chocolates were left with a card wishing me a happy birthday. The manager introduced himself on our arrival and he and the rest of the staff were always helpful and very professional.This was the first time we had asked for an upgrade and actually received one. We travel a lot and have stayed at many hotels. I am quite fussy and I can honestly say I did not have one complaint. The bar, restaurant and mini-bar were expensive, but that is to be expected at a top class hotel. The position of the hotel is great, within walking distance of all amenties. Duane Reade is a good chain of stores that provide everything you need at cheap prices and one store is situated right around the corner. There are also some Deli's very close by so you can get a decent breakfast at a good price. We stayed with family in Long Island for the rest of our trip and they too have only heard good things about the hotel.We would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to family and friends. In addition, we would check out their other hotels first when booking accomodation in other countries.

<Author>sc_UK
<Content>Relaxed and up-market hotel I've just returned from a couple of nights in the Sofitel, New York. I'd done my research when looking around for a hotel and the good reviews on Tripadvisor and the reasonable price were the deciding factors in booking a room here. I should explain that I'm the type of traveller who is rarely happy with the first (or sometimes second) room allocated by the check in staff: I'm a bit picky. From the moment we stepped into the lobby at the Sofitel I could tell that this place was going to be nice. The porters delivered our bags to the room almost immediately: tipping them wasn't the usual embarrassing experience those of us from the UK have to endure in US hotels. Reception staff were very pleasant - a welcome and unusual attribute in this city. Check-in took seconds.The bedroom was on the 23rd floor. It was impeccably clean and a reasonable size, with a great heating / airconditioning system and a very quiet location. The room smelt clean as soon as we opened the door (unlike the room we stayed at a week earlier in the New York Hilton which smelt musty and smoky). The bathroom was spacious and well laid out (separate shower and bath), with nice touches like a freshly cut flower and a candle (with a handy pack of matches too). Although two of us were in the room, the hotel only provided one bath robe and one bottle of water - although they had both of our names and gave us two keys. The bed was a bit on the small side, and I suspect that they assumed only one person was staying in the room.The overall feeling and ambience in this hotel is relaxed and friendly, but professional and up-market, and I would not have any hesitation in recommending it. I will definitely stay there again.  
<Date>Mar 7, 2005

<Author>leannemc
<Content>Great place - a bit pricey! I was impressed with the lobby, but found reception hard to find as it was tucked away past the lobby and around the corner. The staff were pleasant. As my husband and I arrived separately, he had arranged for an upgrade to a suite which he was told would be an extra $100. Upon check out they informed us this was 'per night' which was not clear at the time. They agreed to meet us half way in the end. The suite was lovely and a good size for New York standards. Cable tv and all the usual amenities. Really nice big bath room with candles and toiletries. Sound system throughout all rooms with telephone in the bathroom. Nice comfy bed. Location was great - we walked everywhere, Times Square, 42nd street, Grand Central Station, Central Park (bit of a hike) and Soho by taxi. Overall a nice place and I would go back and stay again. Concierge provided big umberellas and were very helpful. Arranged for a private car to the airport as well.

<Author>lass=
<Content>Excellent service, but needs R Stayed at the hotel in September 2002 for 2 days and July 2004 for 4 days. Good location, as it's slightly off Times Square to avoid the hussle and tourists. Service is excellent. Staff were courteous and fast. What surprised me, however, is the condition of the hotel. While still in decent shape, repair and maintenance clearly needs to be done during my stay in 2004. The standing shower units are kept watertight via a rubber seal. This seal was torn in parts of the shower, resulting in some water being sprayed onto the bathroom floor. I also noted some graffiti on the bathroom wall - minor problems, but something that a first class hotel should deal with.Despite the hotel's minor imperfections, I find that I will still highly recommend this hotel, only if the price is right. Given the amount of selection available in NY, you can't go wrong with the Sofitel, but it may not be the best deal around.  
<Date>Feb 26, 2005

<Author>RhosdduRed
<Content>Very impressed with the Sofitel We just spent 5 nights at the Sofitel and were very happy with what we found. Unfortunately, our request for a high room via the web agent didn't get to the hotel and we ended up with a room on the 11th floor which didn't offer the best view in the world. However, this wasn't the hotel's fault. The hotel has 29 floors so there may have been other rooms which afforded a better view. The room was very well equipped and modern with plenty of room. It was also immaculately clean which is always a bonus. The tv offered direct internet access, cd request facility as well as the usual pay per view for all the latest movies. The bathroom had a bath as well as a separate shower and was quite spacious. No coffee making available though. We never used the turn-down service although it was available.All staff were very helpful especially the front of house staff. When our shuttle transfer to the airport was late, the concierge was ready to spring into action to get us a taxi but thankfully, the shuttle eventually turned up.The location was just right with Times Square, the Empire State Building and the Grand Central Station all within a 10 min walk. Times Sq was very busy especially on the Friday and Saturday and the hotel was a quiet retreat away from the crowds.The hotel bar was one of the nicest we have been in although it was slightly more expensive than the numerous bars and restaurants which were nearly. We are visiting NY again in November and will definitely be staying at the Sofitel again.

<Author>TMM
<Content>Soiftel - C'est Bon! We loved our room at the Sofitel. We had an Executive suite on the 25th floor and our room faced the GE building - A really nice view at night. There was plenty of space for our 22 month old to run around. What surprised me was how quiet it was. The bathrooms are gorgeous and the staff was very helpful, but not in your face. Twice we had a problem with the toilet, but each time we reported the problem it was addressed quickly.There are lots of nice amenities such as the robe, slippers and even a lint brush which was handy as I forgot mine. The location is fantastic and we walked to most places of interest. We also received complimentary drinks of our choice at the bar and late check-out as we signed up for the Sofitel Privilege card.We never dined in-house, but we loved the Red Flame diner a few doors away. It was one of the few places that had high chairs and a good food selection for our son. The breakfast was delicious and the staff was friendly.

<Author>Eric001
<Content>Tripadvisor saves the day again! We had just 2 days and 1 night in NYC so wanted to stay somewhere special that wouldn't bankrupt us. Used Tripadvisor last year for accom in Key West and found a great place. Used them again this time for NYC - checked for the No.1 rated hotel in NYC. Sofitel it was. We arrived by taxi and our suitcases were taken by doorman who gave us tags which we handed to reception when we checked in. I asked for an upgrade and we were upgraded from queen to king room. 2 mins after getting into room our cases arrived. The porter showed us all the features of the room and asked if there was anything we needed. The room, and bathroom, were spotless and well equipped. Most comfortable hotel bed ever! All contact with hotel staff (room service, reception, wake-up call etc) was friendly and efficient and they always used our name. Check out was just as smooth and efficient as the other aspects. We are normally wary of the big hotel chains (we wouldn't have thought of staying here without Tripadvisor reviews) but Sofitel 'broke the mould'. The whole stay was very pleasurable and effortless. It is the first time I have ever wished I was staying longer at a hotel. If you're thinking of staying here - GO FOR IT!

<Author>donshe62
<Content>tres tres magnifique !!. Stayed here for six nights last week of january into February.From the word go I knew I had made the right hotel choice.The absolutely beautiful foyer and desk area were a welcome sight after a long haul flight.The receptionist was a delight,she greeted and made us feel like we were the only guests staying here.I had asked for a twin room on a high floor via e-mail prior to arriving and was assured this was no problem at all.The room allocated was on the 23rd floor right in a very quiet corner,and it was beautiful.Much bigger than in the photos the site prints.Two double beds with luxurious bedding.Floor to ceiling mirrors,lots of closet space.and what felt like brand new carpets.The bathroom was very large and very modern.A huge walk-in shower and lovely fluffy towels and lots of French toiletries.The towels were changed twice a day and flowers and scented candled are positioned there also.Turn down service also great.with complimentary evian water every night. The gym is small but has all up to date excersise machines.The bar looked lovely too,although we did not eat or drink there.There is a restaraunt just a few doors down called the red flame which is perfect for breakfast etc...and very cheap!. All in all I was delighted with this hotel.After a day of exploring and sight seeing I could think of no better place to rest my weary head. If you are going to new york don't stay anywhere else.Pay a little extra and stay at the 'Sofitel'. You will not be sorry.

<Author>dougie-w
<Content>Five-star quality at three-star prices We were drawn to the Sofitel because of its top ranking here at TripAdvisor, then the low rate we found at Hotels ($161/night) clinched it. And we were not disappointed. The room wasn't large, but it did seem luxurious, with lots of nice extras: bathrobe, slippers, CD player, large framed photographs from New York and Paris on the wall. The bathroom was exceptional with its marble sink, glass shower plus separate bathtub. The TV speaker in the bathroom was a little odd, but what the heck. Bed wasn't the most comfortable, but there were plenty of pillows. As others have mentioned, we did receive a tiny complimentary bottle of Evian water each night with the bed turn-down service, but not the fresh bud that I had read about in a previous posting. Location was great, just a couple of blocks from Times Square. Check-in was very quick, friendly and easy. We will definitely be returning to the Sofitel.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Well done Tripadvisor We stayed at the sofitel from the 21st to the 26th January. On the advice of tripadvisor we booked a standard room with a hotel search engine - much cheaper than rates offered direct by sofitel.com. The hotel is very nicely situated between 5th and 6th avenues and 2 blocks from Times sq. The empire state is an easy walk and central park is 15 / 20 mins walk away. The hotel is very pleasant, clean and friendly. The rooms are of good size and very comfrotable, the bathrooms are marble and large. We didnt try the resataurant / bar as it seemed dark and uninviting with loads of staff ready to pounce. On a very minor negative point, all extras in the hotel are quite expensive - minibar, telephones, room service etc - but all these are optional. We will not stay anywhere else in New York again.We would recommend Del Friscos restaurant for beautiful steaks etc (49th and 6th) and for fantastic family meals of really stupid USA quantities try Carmines (44th and 7th). Also when you go up the empire state, do the skyride and sit up at the front.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sorry, another brilliant review! Felt I had to post a review after my stay at this hotel as I enjoyed it so much. (Jan 14-18 2005)As it states in all the other reviews, the staff are brilliant. From the point of arriving to leaving they went the extra mile and were always helpfull, especially the concierge who booked us tables for dinner and advised us on almost everything about New York.The room was very nice and was cleaned twice a day, which meant if you had an afternoon nap, the bed was remade when you got back at night! As promised there were bottles of water and flowers beside the bed each night. It may not sound like much, but it stops you breaking into the min-bar to have a drink, and saves you a few bucks!The bathroom was very large with a bath and very big shower. There were speakers in the bathoom, behind the mirror, so you could listen to the music/tv that was on, and a fluffy dressing gown to name but a few niceties...Our room was on the 19th floor, and the view was of W44th street. Not a great view, however I was realistic to expect that when you stay in the city you may see buildings out of your window. They were not however slap bang outside, and therefore allowed normal light etc into the room. It was no different to staying at many of the hotels I have stayed in in London, Paris etc (I stayed at the Millenium broadway last year, which is the hotel down the road, and although the view was of broadway and was much nicer, the room and staff do not compare.)We ordered room service on two nights, and both times the food was of a high quality and delivered quickly. The person taking the order was also very helpful and friendly, (As opposed to Millenium Broadway, where I felt I was taking a liberty ordering room service!)I can't stress enough how much the staff made the stay a pleasure, combined with the excellent facilities and decor of the hotel. I read a few of the reviews on this site, where people scored it lower as it is not as good as a 5 star hotel. Well all I would say is that this is the best 4 star hotel I have ever stayed in. Its a general rule that you get what you pay for, so if you pay more, then a 5 star will give you more. However I can't think of what else they could do, expept move the building onto broadway. This hotel is exceptional value for money, and we will be staying there again. (P.S. Red flame diner is the most friendliest and best in the locality. We strayed to another because the queue was so big one morning. Big mistake. The menu was a 1/4 of the choice, we waited ages to be served and it was over double the price.)

<Author>freqtraveler
<Content>Great Hotel Stayed for 2 night over the January 14th weekend.Fast checkin. Was slated for a queen bed on the 9th floor. I asked for a higher floor. This was my 3rd trip to NYC and from experience the higher the better to get away from the road noise. The checking agent offered to see if she could get me a king bed while she was at it. I ended up with a king bed on the 18th floor. The room is pretty much how it is pictured on Expedia, bed, two chairs and desk. The bathroom was realy nice, it had a walk in shower and a seperate bath tub. The turn down service is neat if your into that kinda thing. The turn down service came at about 5:30 - 6PM my first night. I was in the room and turned her down. I was offerred a small bottle of Evian thought. Second night I was out of the room and they left the bottle of Evian. I valued the water more than them fussing around the room.Overall, it's a great hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms. I would stay here on my next trip, however, given the hotels popularity on this board it may get pretty worn out.

<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent hotel and location My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights at the start of January 2005 and had been swayed to book this hotel based on the excellent reviews on this website, which proved to be extremely accurate.The hotel is well decorated and we found the reception staff very efficient and co-operative. On arrival we were allocated a room on the 12th floor but made enquiries as to whether we could be moved to a room with a better view. We were offered a room on the 23rd floor and it had a view of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings for no extra cost, so it's definitely worth asking! We also took up the offer on the hotel's website of ordering a Sofitel Privilege Card prior to travel and made use of the 4pm checkout time - also at no extra cost.Our room was clean and spacious and had a lovely bathroom with a separate large walk-in shower. The nightly turndown service includedh a small bottle of water and a weather forecast for the following day, which were nice touches.Due to the excellent location of the hotel, we found we were able to walk to most of the attractions in midtown Manhattan - only 10 mins from Times Square and 15-20 mins from the Empire State Building. Central Park was about 30-40 mins walk away.Although very pleased with the hotel itself, there were a couple of things that let us down personally. The first was some information requested from our concierge. We had asked him to confirm our return flight details on the day of departure and were wrongly advised as to which terminal we needed to get to and the second was that despite informing reception at check-in that we wished to make use of the 4pm check-out, we received 2 visits from staff while we were packing asking us when we were due to leave the room as they had no record of our request.Also, one word of advice on taxis - there is currently a flat-rate fee of $45 + toll ($4) and tip from JFK to midtown Mahattan but this does not apply to the return trip! Our return taxi fare cost $60, exclusive of toll and tip so make sure you have some extra dollars if you're down to your last few!!

However they would not guarantee me a high floor. <Author>reninlondon
<Content>LOVED THE SOFITEL - RECOMMEND AGAIN AND AGAIN Ok well here goes......... I was deliberating for ages as to which hotel i should go for. My boyfriend and I were spending 4 nights in new york over xmas (25th to 29th december) and i wanted to make sure the hotel was 1) beautiful with all the luxurious facitities i needed 2) wasn't extortionately pricedOriginally , I had booked the marriot marquis which i stayed in with my girlfriends last year. Average hotel but as many of the reviews stated , very impersonal and for the amount you pay, you just feel like a number. And i thought nearer the time id keep checking expedia, and all the travel sites and if i could get a better room in a better hotel then i would cancel the marriot (one good thing u can cancel at the marriot marquis up to 6pm on the day of arrival with no charge) When we got to new york the marriot was packed and there were problems getting on a lift because of the amount of people there.I had a room booked for $279 per night for 4 nights but it was average and to upgrade to a suite would have been some ridiculous price of $500 per night just because of the location of the hotel (marquis is right bang cente of times square)So we cancelled the marriot and went to the sofitel who at the last minute have internet rates of of 309 per night for an executive suite.We thought, why not pay a bit more and get a nicer room.We were not disappointed.They are both in great locations and within one block of each other.Sofitel is walking distance from all the main shops macys. saks, all the touristy bits , times square. Perfect location.next review :the room - it was clean, spacious and on the 26th floor The bed amazing, usual 5 star standard, plush sheets, v good quality, we had a lounge area with a sofa which we could shut off from the bedroom as there were french doors separating the two rooms.2 tvs, bathroom with deep plunge bath and a massive walk in shower.Most hotels only give one or the other.They give all the amenities that a good 4/5 star should have, robes, lovely candle in the bathroom ,nice french bath products, on demand tv, with movies, internet access if you need it for 9.95 dollars per day surcharge,24 hour roomservice. We even wanted a fridge so we could store all our little drinks and snacks and they brought this up to our room at no charge.View is amazing, from our window we could see all the skyscraper buildings. Have to say you could get stuck in a lovely room with no view if you dont ask but for the price you pay it depends on what your priorities are.Some people must have an amazing view, i just wanted a lovely room in luxurious surroundings, but luckily got both.They also have a gym on the basement - cant comment as didnt end up goingalso - gift shop - is amazing, the most unique gifts were on sale when i went so ended up doing some last minute shopping before i left for people back home.Any cons ?well one thing is the tax I think this is just for us dummies that aren't used to it rather than a hotel specific thing.We ordered room service on the first night,US tax - 3.25 per order, plus sales tax of about 8% plus some other tax of 17 % (i think this is services tax) For the amount we paid the food was quite basic and im sure i could have got a better burger in some restaurant outside if i had made the effort to go out. but i suppose thats the whole point of room service.in any case, this shouldnt draw you from going to the hotel.You will be right in the centre of new york so its easy to find something to eat round the corner.Also front desk were really helpful, but had some difficulty understanding me as most of them were french and i was english.No big deal, by the end of my stay i knew them all on first name terms and i learnt to speak a bit slower to accomodate them.ok i think thats it - to conclude, great hotel, if you can get the executive suites at a good price, i suggest book . Watch out for the taxes but thats just new york. Would go back to the sofitel again. I pretty much know all the hotels in new york because of the amount of research i did for the holiday and i think this is one of the best ones going for the price you can pay!!

<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>AnywhereUSA310
<Content>A Paradise Compared to Other New York Hotels After two horrible nights at the Algonquin, I got smart and moved down the street to the Sofitel. For exactly $10 more a night than I was paying at the Algonquin, I got a room that was four times the size of my dingy miserable room at the Algonquin. At the Algonquin, I looked out at a airshaft. At the Sofitel, I was on the 24th floor, with a nice view of the skyline. At the Algonquin, there was a miniscule bathroom with a combination tub, shower. At the Sofitel, I had a huge, beautiful bathroom with separate shower and tub, lots of counter space, nice French toiletries and a makeup mirror. At the Alongquin, there were two tiny elevators that you had to wait forever for. At the Sofitel, there were four huge elevators that came immediately.The Sofitel room was nicely layed out, with two chairs to sit in by the window, a nice desk to work at and ample closet space. Someone else at this site complained about the turndown service. I thought it was great. I didn't even know they had turndown service (they certainly didn't at the Alongquin) and I left clothes strewn on my bed - when I came back at night, the clothes were all neatly folded, my bed turned down, the curtains closed, a bottle of Evian on the nightstand, together with the next day's weather forecast. Lovely! The staff also couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, with no attitude (unlike at some of the more trendy hotels in NYC). Perhaps the thing I liked the best at the Sofitel was that it was dead quiet. I heard no street noise whatsoever, nor any noise from any of the other rooms. I also loved the fact that the curtains completely blocked out the light at night (at the Algonquin, they had these strange blinds that did not completely darken the room). Someone else on this site complained that at the Sofitel your morning wake-up call is not from a live person (it's just a ring on the phone). As for me, I don't care about chatting with a live operator for my morning wake-up call - what I value is quiet and a spacious, attractively furnished room and I got that at the Sofitel for a very reasonable price. I'll be back.P.S. My only quibble with the Sofitel was the bar (I didn't try the restaurant). For a French hotel, they didn't have a very good selection of French wines by the glass and the white wine was served over-chilled. But those are really very minor quibbles - there are a million other places to go for a drink in the neighborhood.  
<Date>Dec 24, 2004
<Rating>5	5	5	-1	5	-1	5	-1	

<Author>LMS39
<Content>Quietly elegant! I brought my mother-in-law to NYC for the first time on Columbus Day and wanted our room to be perfect. We were not disappointed with the Sofitel. Although the city was exceptionally crowded and noisey due to the holiday parades, we found luxurious tranquility from the moment we entered the front door. Every staff person we encountered was friendly, helpful and respectful. They performed their duties impecably without being obtrusive or pushy. The room was very clean with single beds more like doubles. The bedding was immaculate with the look and feel of being brand new. The bathroom was gorgeous with a shower stall the size of many NY bathrooms. The fresh orchid and candle in the bathroom and the thick terry cloth robes and slippers were the extra little touches that made us feel as if we were staying at a European Spa. If you are looking for hi-tech flash and urban splash, the Sofitel is not for you, but if you can appreciate understated elegance and Old World sensibilities, you will not be disappointed with the Sofitel.  
<Date>Dec 23, 2004
<Rating>5	4	4	-1	5	-1	5	-1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>"Bonjour" does not make a luxury experience!!!! I stayed in this hotel in November and was quite frankly very disappointed with it. Turn down service was nothing but to flip my bedspread over on a bed that was used by me during the day to lie on and had been terrbly wrinkled. No ice, no replacement of the used towels, nothing special at all and the wake up call was done with a machine instead of a human being. No doorman or bellman ever greeted or opened the doors when coming to or leaving the hotel.The icing on the cake was when I called to inquire about my trimmer that I possitively left in the bathroom, a machine took a message and after four days someone called and left a message that they did not have it. No offer of apology or replacement whatsoever. For $280 a night, I expect much better services than was given in this hotel. I would rather have had a first class service commitment from a hotel than a bonjour machine wake up call!!!

<Rating>1	1	4	-1	5	-1	2	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved the Sofitel NY We loved the Sofitel NY! We just got back from a 4 day trip to NYC and loved it. Christmas time is the best time to experience NYC. Everyone was very nice and the city looked even more beautiful with x-mas lights. We were a bit scared booking online and paying over $1100.00 for the rooms but we couldn't have been more satisfied! As soon as we walked into the marbled floor lobby I knew we had made the right choice. The staff was very friendly and with the loyalty card, sign up online at the sofitel website for free, we received a welcome cocktail. Our room was on the 27th floor with a spectacular view, like requested. The room was sooo clean and the bathrooms were wonderful. We each got a bathrobe and slippers and every night our bed was turned down and we were left one bottle of water, chocolates, flowers, and the next day's weather forecast. The location made the hotel even better. We were walking distance from everything like Times Square, 5th Ave., Park Ave., and the Today show. If it is your first time in NYC I suggest you stay at Sofitel and take the Sightseeing Tour, they are wonderful and very informative. The best restaurant would be Del Frisco, pricey but great!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Just average My husband and I spent three nights during the week of Thanksgiving at the Sofitel. I booked the room based on location, and Trip Advisor reviews. We spent $299/night, and had a room on the 23rd floor. Our first impression was not favorable...there were no bellman at the entrance, and we lugged our bags to check-in. The room was standard...the carpeting was absolutely filthy. We would of asked to move, if we weren't so tired, and had already been informed at check-in that no upgrades were available. We were left 1 bottle of water nightly, with a sprig of orchids in the bathroom...not my idea of luxury. Most guests were European. The concierge was helpful in getting us a driver to the airport. We also ate breakfast at the Red Flame Diner several days, which was convienent and cheap. The best attribute is location. This hotel certainly does not rate close to the Ritz as trip advisor reviews suggest.

<Author>frskev
<Content>Just short of exceptional I stayed at the Sofitel over the Thanksgiving period. Was really looking forward to my stay after watching the reviews on this site. We arrived and entered through an exceptional lobby although no help with the bags.Check in was great, Francois was very helpful. We had two rooms booked and he arranged them on the 20th floor near to each other. One has a great view of the Chrysler building and the other a great view of the rockefeller center.The rooms were fine, excellent decor although the bathroom in one room was just starting to show some wear (on ceiling paintwork and wallpaper). Otherwise the bathrooms were fantastic, nice sink and wet room. Selection of shampoo/soap/gels was brilliant and the candle  orchid were nice touches. The bathroom overall was excellent, finished to a high standard, just needed a little bit of making good, 10 mins work to bring up to brand new standard.Bed area was brilliant. Free water at turndown was nice, although the maid came very early one evening before 1800. Bath robe and slippers in the lit closet were nice.We did not use the restaurant although it looked nice enough. We opted to take breakfast at the red flame diner at the end of the block which served a good breakfast with quick efficient service. There is also a starbucks at the rear of the hotel.Checkout was equally efficient. The only thing that stops me from giving this hotel the highest rating was the attitude of the concierge on the last day. We stored our bags whilst we went out the conceirge who did this, Chris was very good. When we reclaimed them a different conceirge was on duty, he made little if any eye contact at all and did not say a single word, he just called a porter over to get the bage out. I found this unacceptable, it seems that some guests were more worthy of his assistance than others.Overall though very good hotel and I would return.

<Author>LPW
<Content>Concierge couldn't be more helpful The concierges Vladimir and Rene were very helpful: Vlad confirmed our helicopter trip, Rene chose and booked us a table at the Gotham Bar  Grill. Hotel is very smart and excellent location between 5th and 6th on 44th St. Twin deluxe room on 21st floor with view of the GE building - though Travelocity website had said there were views of Chrysler/Empire.Top tip: Go to the Sofitel website and order a privilege card (which is free): This will enable you to check out as late as 4pm (usually 12 noon) and a welcome cocktail from the Gaby bar - these would have been $11 each so well worth filling out your details online!Only criticism was the car that the porter organised for the trip back to JFK - when the driver received a more 'lucrative' phonecall/booking, we were passed over to a yellow cab driver who only received $40 of the $55 we had given the first driver to give to the taximan. Seems there are some thieves wherever you go.On the whole, I would recommend this hotel for its location, big rooms, lovely bathroom and the concierge service.

<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent We stayed at the Sofitel for 7 nights from 2 October 2004. The moment we walked into the hotel I knew I had made the right choice. I had based my decision solely on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. All the staff were very polite  helpful. There were plenty of staff at reception so you never had to wait more than a few seconds to be attended to. The standard double room was very spacious, with an attractive bathroom that comprised bath  separate shower cubicle. We asked the concierge to recommend a fairly relaxed, reasonably priced Italian restaurant in the area and the one she recommended, the Resette, was perfect. Being a business hotel the breakfast can be a bit pricey but the Red Flame Diner, about 5 doors down from the hotel, is a traditional American diner that provides a fantastic breakfast for great value. The queues tell all but don't be put off - the queue moves fast. The location of the hotel is also ideal. 15 minutes leisurely walk to the Empire State Building in one direction  less than 10 minutes walk to Times Square in another direction. The hotel is located right between 5th  6th Avenues so you really are right in the centre of Manhattan but it's on a relatively quiet street. We saw a Broadway show one night  returned to the hotel on foot at 1am. The walk back to the hotel took approx 10 mins via main streets and is well lit. We felt perfectly safe. We definitely want to return to New York  we would definitely return to the Sofitel.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wow Well what can I say that others haven't already said. Excellent location right in the heart of Manhattan, just off 5th Ave, shop 'til you drop!Hotel was clean with impressive lobby and the check in/check out was friendly and effecient. We had an executive king suite on the 26th, the view is maybe not as good as the hotels situated next to Central Park but is not bad and looks better at night when everything is lit up. Rooms were cleaned daily with a turn down service and cleaned and maintained to a high standard. Had 2 Tv's and CD player in the room, bathrooms had a wonderful deep, deep bath, and a very effecient seperate shower. Good quality bath/shower products were provided along with bathrobes and slippers.Breakfasts were good and also the bar snacks although we never dined at the hotel in the evening, so cannot comment on that. The only minor negative comment I can make is that sometimes the waiters in the bar done a disappearing act and you sat and waited some time for someone to attend to you. It did not seem to occur to the the waiter/waitress behind the bar to call someone to take your order. By English standards the drinks and food were not expensive when compared to hotels of a similiar standard in England. All in all this was a great trip and the hotel room and staff in general were above average. Would hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic Stay We stayed at the Sofitel from 23-28th August. We got married in the Empire State Building during our stay so it was important to us that the hotel was just what we wanted and after a lot of research (and going on previous reviews here) we picked the Sofitel and it was the perfect choice. We had an Executive King Suite with a great view including the Chrysler building. It was very roomy (lounge/bedroom/hall/dressing area etc), was spotlessly clean and totally soundproofed - we didn't hear a thing from either inside or outside the hotel the whole time we were in the room! The bathroom was gorgeous and throughout the suite and in all the public rooms the decor is lovely - modern but not too modern and it all looks brand new. The bed was very comfortable and the room so calming - a great place to relax and chill out after a day in the city. The location is very central  every member of staff we came accross was polite and friendly. On one occasion we couldn't lock our door and it was put right the instant we reported it - I've never had such quick service! When we left to get married we intended to take a cab and the doorman (William I think) instead of calling a cab summoned us a merecdes seemingly out of nowhere. The hotel also put champagne and chocolates in our room with a note of congratulations. Others in our party stayed at a variety of 45* hotels in the city while we were there and we all agreed that the Sofitel was the best. I am fussy about hotels but honestly can't think of any negative points about our stay here. We will definately be returning to New York - its an amazing city - and without any doubt will be staying at the Sofitel on our future trips. Apart from the hotel the Red Flame diner is a great breakfast experience (is a few doors down from the hotel), the Algonquin (next door) perfect for romantic cocktails and the River Cafe under the Brooklyn Bridge is awesome in every way and a 'must-do' for any special occassions!

<Author>PleaseDont
<Content>A lovely and welcoming oasis in the city Just got back from three nights at the Sofitel. A friend and I (both female) stayed in a twin room that we reserved on their website for $199 for the first two nights and $239 for the third (the Saturday before the RNC convention). We were delighted with the hotel. We arrived at nearly 2 am and were greeted warmly. They were giving us a room on the 17th floor when I mentioned something about liking a view, and they changed us to the 22nd floor. The view was very enjoyable (not spectacular, but there are a lot of tall buildings in the area, as someone else mentioned). The beds were VERY comfortable (they seemed wider than normal twins). Nice robes, nice towels, beautiful big bath with nice furnishings and products. The air conditioning was very good, and the sound-proofing excellent (we opened the lower window in the morning and were surprised at the noise). We ordered room-service coffee each morning, which arrived hot and fresh in short order. I will look for Chris at the concierge desk next time, based on reviews here--I had called ahead to try to get tickets for a particular show and spoke to a different concierge, who was basically no help.My only suggestion to the hotel would be more drawer space--there is only one small drawer in the desk/console, which is already filled with stationery, etc., and two square drawers in the beside table, one of which is already filled with phone books. We never tried the lobby bar as the light was always off--maybe next time. We appreciated the bottles of Evian (one hot and humid morning we noticed a stack of bottles and a stack of towels next to the front door--nice touch!). The location is terrific. I will definitely stay here again.  
<Date>Aug 30, 2004
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>Hab
<Content>Hotel nice. Do not use valet parking. Beware!! Husband and I stayed at Sofitel New York to celebrate our anniversary weekend. Room was very nice. We've stayed in other Times Square area hotels with substandard rooms. Lobby was welcoming and very relaxing. Candles, tables, nice furniture etc. Nice to relax, read, rest your feet. Although this may seem small it's a great asset in the middle of New York City. Most hotels do NOT offer such a nice, peaceful lobby environment. Actual was very clean. Important!!! Bathroom was clean. Important!!! View was great! Important! Room had small table and chairs. Nice! Front desk staff very nice. Doorman and concierge staff very nice and helpful. Okay....the bad news. We parked our Toyota Landcruiser using hotel valet service. I was a little leary because someone drives your car to a parking garage at another location. My husband said let's go ahead and do it. I preferred to park across the street (diagonal) from the hotel for twelve dollars cheaper (not much but.....). We used valet service. Next day upon checking out our truck was brought by valet service. My husband checked the driver side of the vehicle and asked me to check to the passenger side. I found a nice sized scratch on the rear quarter panel. Mind you...we detail our truck every week so....we know what scratches were there. Once wd notified the hotel doorman, he called the head of security who was STANDOFFISH! He was obviously not thrilled that he had to deal with our problem but neither were we! After all we paid $40.00 for parking and a SCRATCH! It took us over an hour for pictures to be taken, report written etc. To date (over two weeks ago) we still have not heard from the representative from the parking garage. My husband has left several messages. The person in charge is never available....hmmmm????? I would recommend the hotel (maybe) but not the valet parking. If you value your car and do not want any extra dents or scratches....do NOT use VALET. Once I hear from parking staff (if ever)....I'll post a follow up.  
<Date>Aug 24, 2004
<Rating>3	3	4	-1	5	-1	3	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sophisticated Sofitel We have just returned from staying at the Sofitel as part of our honeymoon (11-13 August) which we booked on expedia. We found the Hotel to be very modern and sophisticated, a vast improvement on other hotels we have stayed in in New York on previous trips. The location is superb, convenient for Times Square but also conveniently located away from the hustle and bustle of the same. Door staff and reception staff were extremely polite and friendly. The Concierge staff were excellent and we were very pleased with their recommendations for places to eat and drink. The Concierge was good at translating our wishes into good suggestions. Having had the benefit of an upgrade on account of our honeymoon our King room was extremely well presented and spacious particularly for a hotel in NYC. We have stayed in 5 star hotels with much less to offer. Our only gripe, and it is not a major one, relates to the hotel bar. Having arrived back to the hotel from a night at the theatre ( we saw Sly Fox which was very funny!) we were disappointed at the manner in which we were rushed to finish our drinks because of general activity from staff in the bar and restaurant that indicated that the bar was closing and maybe we were keeping people from going home.However, we would go back.  
<Date>Aug 23, 2004
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>YoMan
<Content>Very Good Hotel, Spacious Suites Near Theatre District My family and I stayed here for 3 nights in August, 2004. This hotel has a central location for most mid-town activities. 44th street is somewhat busy and not particularly attractive, but the hotel itself is very nice and is tastefully decorated. We stayed in a suite, which had a nice living area and good bathroom with separate tub and shower. While large for NYC, the suites here are not as big as Chicago Water Tower. Gaby's restaurant was excellent. Room service was very fast (20 min on average). Room service food was good, but somewhat limited menu. I would stay here again. However just to counter earlier reviewers that stated this is better than 4 seasons NYC. I definitely disagree. Stayed at the 4 seasons as well on this trip, see separate review. The 4 Seasons is a cut above, both in room quality and service. Of course it is twice the price as well. For Value and a high quality room, Sofitel is the winner. For that extra luxury and pampering, and upscale location in shopping area, choose the 4 seasons.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awesome One of my most pleasant experiences. I went to the Sofitel with my husband not knowing that much about their properties except that this location was right in the heart of where I wanted to be. First off, this hotel has a very classy feel and ambiance as soon as you enter the door. I thought the room was tastefully done and the view was nice, not great, but what do you expect when your so close to Times Square with all those high rise buildings around you. I was able to get tickets to a broadway show thanks to the wonderful concierge Chris, who also booked us a table at a great restauraunt on short notice. If you stay at the Sofitel, I recommend him very highly to take care of your needs. We needed a late check out and I was able to get an extension by a lovely lady at the front desk named Tammy. I really felt appreciated and was so happy me and my husband were able to have an enjoyable weekend without the usual hustle and bustle that I've experienced at other hotels who only care about the botton line. Was checked out by the bellhop Frankie who was very charming and helpful. I can't find any reason Not to stay here.

I understand liking this hotel because of its central location and decent (stress decent) accomodations, but all of these glowing reviews have me wondering why everyone believes this hotel to be so much more than it really is. Folks, it is a far cry from one of the top hotels in the world.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Location, Great Hotel (with a minor exception) We booked the Sofitel online for $160 per night (awesome deal!) and were very impressed with the hotel. It is centrally located (not too far north or south), and maintains a boutique feel. The staff was excellent and helpful. They even told me where to get cheaper tickets to Phantom when I inquired with the Concierge. We were always greated with Bonjour.Regarding the room, it was larger than what you would expect in NYC - incredible bathroom with marbled floors and walls, a full bath and separate shower stall. My only comment was about their internet. For some reason, it didn't work in our room and when we called the front desk, they said they'd send someone up - 15 minutes later, someone came up and gave us new cables, still didn't work. Then I called the 3-rd party 800 number associated with the service and fiddled with it for another 1/2 hour. When that didn't work, they said they'd contact the hotel directly and work it out with them. Well, they never called and when I called the front desk, they apologized profusely and said someone would be up. Someone did come up - and handed us a new set of cables - urgh. In the end, it just wasn't worth the hassle. At least they tried, though.Outside of that, everything was wonderful.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Most enjoyable stay Having made a reservation at the hotel in late July of this year based on the recommendations of this site, I have to admit to being very impressed. The staff were very courteous and extremely helpful, the room was very spacious and furnished to a high standard with excellent facilities. The central location of the hotel and access to the local transportation make it an ideal place for site seeing. The room rate is very competitive for the standard offered and compares exceptionally well against other hotels of a similar, and higher, rating. Having been fortunate to stay in a number of the finest hotels in NYC this has been one of the best experiences to date - it is not quite the Plaza, but is significantly better than the Waldorf. I would have no hessitation in recommending this hotel and if I were to offer any criticism it would be the same one levelled at most hotels i.e. overpriced mini-bar.

<Author>CLascelles
<Content>Fantastic! We spent 5 nights at this hotel earlier in the year, and had a truly marvellous time. The staff were helpful and polite (saying, Bonjour and Bonsoir to us every time we walked past them), and the room was gorgeous with a nice, big, comfortable bed, and quite a nice view of the city. Also, the bathroom was extremely clean and well-presented, and the toiletries smelt absolutely delicious!It's definitely worth getting a Sofitel card, as we had one, and got a free drink in the bar and a late check-out with it. It's also worth shopping around for the best price; we used Airline Network's website and only paid around $180 a night for the room, which is brilliant considering the hotel's central location. All in all, we had a wonderful trip to the States (our first time there), and will definitely stay at the Sofitel when we're next in New York.

<Author>AZheat
<Content>Had a wonderful time at the Sofitel My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel July 9  10th. The hotel is everything we expected and then some. We were on the 10th floor exec. suite. The room was wonderful, clean, and very large. The special touches of candels and flowers in the bathroom were perfect, everything about the room was to our satisfaction.The location was great for us, near Time Square, Empire State Bldg, Grand Central St., Central Park was a 20 minute brisk walk, we loved it. If your in new york during good weather walk over to Bryant Park around happy hour time, it's just a few blocks away , the desk will give you directions , its a beautiful park with outdoor bars and restaurants with a great crowd to mix with or just people watch. Dining note: the best pizza I have ever had (and I'm italian) is a place in the village called Lombardi's, brick oven cooked it's worth the wait and subway trip over, plus the village is a fun place to see. Our trip was perfect and the Sofitel is not to be missed.

<Author>guye
<Content>Unremarkable We stayed here for four nights in July essentially on the strength of previous reports here on Tripadvisor. This was our first trip to New York, and we were particularly pleased with the location of this hotel; it was very close (10mins walk max) to Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Central Park, and the Empire State building.Apart from the location we found little else exceptional about this hotel. We had a reasonably pleasant two-bed room on the sixth floor where the decor was a little tired, the view was of the building across the road, and the bathroom was small but functional. The public areas were well furnished and we found the staff fairly pleasant. The rate we paid ($300 / night in July) was not excessive, and perhaps our expectations had been raised by all the great reviews here, but I sincerely hope this isn't the best hotel in New York. We'll be trying somewhere else when we return in December.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>"Arrive with a smile, leave with a smile" This was my husband and my first trip to New York. We figured, what better way to spend the 4th of July, than in New York, under the Macy's fireworks display, and how AWESOME they were! We spent many hours reading reviews of various hotels, service and accomodations, before picking the Sofitel. The minute we arrived we knew we had picked the right hotel. The doorman met us cheerfully, removed and brought in our bags and answered any and all questions we had. Our room was not ready (we arrived at 11:00 and check in is at 3:00) so the concierge stored our bags and we left to explore grand central station. Upon returning to the hotel we were given our room, on the 24th floor!! Well worth waiting for. We had a beautiful view of the Chrysler building. It is so beautiful both day and night. The Sofitels location was wonderful. We walked almost everywhere, and if something was a little too far for walking we jumped on the subway at grand central (21/2 blocks away) using our metro card. There are restaurants and food venders everywhere so there is no shortage of choices. We ate breakfast quite often at the Red Flame Diner (5 or 6 doors down from the Sofitel) that offers a wide selection of hearty breakfasts for a very good price. The Sofitel is in walking distance to the broadway shows, shopping, central park, and the many museums. Location is key!! We even saw a T.V. personality check in at the Sofitel. I can't say enough about the Sofitel, the staff was very courteous and professional, rooms were extremely clean, lobby was classy and inviting. The Sofitel will again be our choice in the future.

<Author>kitty33
<Content>So-fi-fi-fabulous! We stayed at the Sofitel over the July 4th weekend after reading the reviews on this site. We received a very good rate on a king bed suite located on the 26th floor. WOW! Beautiful, comfortable, luxurious room with every amenity and detail you can imagine. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful and sophisticated. The staff are friendly and are willing to give you as much or as little attention as you desire. The rooms are simply to die for. Large marble bath with deep tub, separate shower, fluffy towels, wonderful and plentiful toiletries, great lighting etc. The room itself was plush and the furnishing were chic and comfortable. Many, many details! The closets are lighted and contained great robes, slippers, iron and board, tie and belt hooks, numerous wood and padded hangers, safe and other amenities. The lighting in the room and bath is extremely well done. I particularly the artwork and picture lights which gave the room a very sophisticated flair. Great view, 2 tv's with speaker in bath, sliding pocket doors between bedroom and sitting room, good, quiet AC with two separate thermostats in bedroom and sitting room. Many, many good pay-per-view movies and other online services.Housekeeping is flawless. Twice daily service with Evian water and next day's weather report supplied at turn down. Room service was good but VERY expensive, my only complaint. Fresh flowers in bath and on room service trays. Basically, they thought of every detail and did everything right!We liked the hotel so much that after we got there, we booked a room for my mother-in-law last minute as a special birthday treat. She had a regular queen room which was smaller, but spacious and had the same level of detail and luxury as our suite. I have stayed in over 20 NYC hotels over the years including the Plaza, Peninsula, Carlyle, Four Seasons etc. and have to say that this was by far my favorite NYC hotel experience. I was VERY impressed and will not hesitate to stay at a Sofitel anywhere in the world from now on. For value and luxury, simply the best!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Was there during the blackout I was really impressed with how the staff handled the blackout last summer. They had a generator that kept the elevators working until after 8 pm, so that we could get to our rooms. We had no idea that so many people were turned out of their rooms at other hotels just around the corner in Times Square. We slept peacefully in air-conditioned comfort that night. Some of the staff even stayed 24 hours, slept an hour or two up on the hotel roof and were there to serve breakfast the next morning. The whole thing was handled calmly and with abundant professionalism. Kudos to the very capable staff!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Peaceful and relaxing Stayed at the Sofitel 6/19-24. Usually stay in Times Square area, but wanted to try a new area of NYC. The Sofitel was wonderful. The doormen were attentive; the front desk courteous, and the maid service was excellent. Fresh towels provided twice a day and when we asked for more, they were at our room within minutes with a stack of towels. There was turn down service, fresh flowers in bathroom, fluffy bathrobe to wear, and bottles of Evian water left nightly. Our room was on the 7th floor; view was nothing special from our room, but this hotel was so quiet, we slept like babies. The beds are very comfortable. Red Flame Grill next door is very good and reasonable. The bathrooms are spacious, separate shower, French toiletries provided. Only down side is no coffeemaker or fridge. That would have been nice. Prices in mini-bar were typically outrageous. Nice location, easy walk to theatres and Fifth Avenue, subway is two blocks away at 42/Bryant Park. Room was not that spacious and was expensive $274, but it was clean, safe, and a nice place to stay. Would go back again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good, clean, fun Just came back from staying at the Sofitel for 4 nights and was very pleased. Great location, very courteous staff, and - if you're lucky (I was!) - you can even get a view of the Chrysler building from your room. Don't expect anything extraordinary from the rooms, which are standard for a hotel of this grade (which is fine), although they are generously-sized for Manhattan. The restaurant is a bonus too: very good food and excellent staff. The Sofitel is a good safe bet: you won't be let down.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>First time stay but am going back - Deliciously satisfied customer. First time stay but am going back - Deliciously satisfied......Looked at various hotels, canceled reservations several times for my May 20th - 23rd, 2004 NYC stay. Worth every dollar of each nite's stay! The Executive Suite on the 26th floor, Room 2614 awesome view, state of the art bathroom which house's a separate shower, semi garden style tub, marble counters  floors, toiletries are French perfumed. Hotel provided two small four piece chocolate boxes, a large bottle of Evian water at no addl. charge. The suite is approx. 600 sq ft. My rate per nite; $400.00. The location is about the only flaw for me (probably for no one else though, am too picky). I would have preferred the Sofitel at the Marriot Marquis location! That would have been the ultimate Plaza Hotel for me!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A very ggod deal We just returned from a 3 nights-stay in NYC over this may 20-23 week-end. As a Gold VIP at Hilton I had firs booked teh Waldorf-Adtoria, but after readin some reviews on this site, I preffered to cancel, and try Sofitel. We're French, but that did not specifically made us go for it. Now, the location is perfect, the staff is courteous and helpful (helped us in locating some stores in the Village, some information about our flight supposed to leave shortly after the Paris airport accident was proptly given to us). The rooms are clean, bathrooms are very nice. I would recommend to try to check an upper floor room to get some view (we were on the 23rd, barely decent in terms of view but still enjoyable). Also, we required a late check out before getting the shuttle pick-up for our flight. They made no problem about it (another advantage of the Sofitel card: it DOES give something to the customer, while Hilton is just flattering egos by giving Gold or Diamond cards, which give nothing to their customers). The only downside is that I would recommend to carefully heck your bill: we had an Internet Special rate, which was not considered at first, and they charged us a much higher price. After discussion with the front desk, this was fixed (and I remember reading other reviews about the same kind of problem). For breakfast, as many people here said before, get out of teh hotel, make a right a get to the Red Flame. They're NOT nice people and they don't really care for their customers. But it's a good value for a breakfast in NYC. All in all, we'll definitely stay again at the Sofitel Hotel NY during our next escape over there.

<Author>retep68
<Content>Above average hotel in an excellent location. Booked my stay at the Sofitel largely due to the reviews on here (was going to stay at the Tribeca Grand, but that had terrible reviews back then). Can't say that I agree with the rave reviews the hotel gets on this site. The staff were OK, but certainly didn't go out of their way to help.When I asked for a late check out I was told I couldn't have one, even though I had emailed a request for one weeks earlier (I received a reply confirming the late check out). The receptionist, for some reason, seemed quite pleased to be able to deny me this. However, I then produced my sofitel priviledged guest card and the receptionist had to agree to the late check out.The room was excellent, large with a good view (22nd floor - requested high floor with booking and also backed this up by email a few weeks before travelling). Bathroom was good, but again not as good as the reviews here indicate. No tea / coffee making facilities in the room (is this a US thing?) and a tea and coffee brought up to the room cost circa $20!!!! (coffee was excellent though!).Mid-town location is probably the best thing about the hotel. 5th Ave about 40 yards away. 5 mins to either Times Sq or Grand Central to get the subway, so a piece of piss to get just about anywhere in Manhattan.Personally will try the Tribeca Grand next time, partly because I tend to spend more time downtown, but mainly because the Sofitel just didn't live up to my expectations. A good 4* hotel, but that's it, nothing exceptional.

The hotel is very clean, quiet, and calm and the staff is courteous, friendly, and helpful. Location is just right, near many sights but not in the middle of them. The Red Flame down the street is a great place for breakfast. We are totally happy with our stay at the Sofitel.

<Author>vixs
<Content>Not All What We Expected After doing a great deal of research on New York hotels I decided on the Sofitel due to the exceptional reviews on this site, however my stay was most disappointing and I feel I have to leave my view here. On arriving I asked pleasantly if they had any rooms on a high floor only to be told none were available and was given a key to a room on the 6th floor. I was very excited to see the room as I had read many good things, however I found the room was pleasant and comfortable but not the luxurious elegant room I was expecting and the view was non-existent! In fact parts of the room looked a little worn. After exploring further we found the toilet was blocked so went down to reception to complain, they immediately sent for the maintenance guy but after 15 minutes he was still struggling and we asked for another room, this time we were offered a room on a higher floor (surprisingly they miraculously found a higher room even though my previous request was denied). Our stay for the next 6 days was pleasant enough, I must say the one good thing going for this hotel is the location as it seemed to be within walking distance of most attractions, the staff also were pleasant and polite but not in the friendly sense. Towards the end of our stay while brushing my teeth what should happen but the u-bend fell off the sink spilling water everywhere, again they sent the maintenance guy to fix it and we were offered a complementary breakfast (on leaving they attempted to charge me for this breakfast!) I will never be staying at the Sofitel New York again; my advice for others would be to give this place a miss and check into the friendly Algonquin a few doors down, which has a genuinely friendly atmosphere, which the Sofitel lacked.

<Author>billymax
<Content>Probably New Yorks finest 4 star hotel ? Just returned....wedding anniversary.Like most others we booked this hotel after reading web comments. If you want a 5 star hotel and want to pay 5 star prices go elsewhere. If however you want an excellent 4star in a superb position and want to pay a reasonable price then this is it.We had an executive king room (read suite), large and beautifully furnished throughout , great marble bathroom, dressing area, separate sitting room and 2 tv's, stereo, really comfy bedroom, nice toiletries, candles,towels changed twice a day and bed linen every 2 days, quiet and airy. evening turn down service flowers and Evian mini bar. View from our room (14th floor) wasn't very interesting and although the hotel offered a change on night 3 out of 7 in the end we couldn't be bothered to move. Room decor beige and white and more light fittings than I've ever seen in a room. Very restful.It's a great base to return to after the most exhausting but enjoyable 7 night (8 day) first time trip to New York. Concierge was helpful and the doorman fantastic at getting cabs. All staff were courteous and friendly. Room was ready when we arrived at 2-30pm and we had a late 4-00pm (no extra charge) checkout. Didn't eat or drink in the hotel, pre booked great restaurants from London. ( Red Flame for breakfast or the food court at Grand Central Terminal (we can't take the big cooked breakfast every day)), River Cafe, Boathouse, Gramercy Tavern, Balthazar. Saw Don Giovani at the beautiful Met Opera House (nice Italian restaurant opposite...can't remember name) and don't miss the Carnegie Deli. Woody Allen plays Dixieland Jazz at the Cafe Carlyle on a Monday (extortionate but a fantasic evening). Did all the main sights and areas.......hardly stopped to catch breath. The Frick Collection is stupendous. There is so much to see and do and we only scratched the surface. New York is probably the most friendly and exciting city in the world and this hotel contibuted in no small part to a wonderful experience. If you want to do museums galleries and shops , walk the town from end to end and sample the nighlife you can't do so unless you have a good comfortable base to return to. This is in our opinion is it. We will return.  
<Date>Apr 30, 2004

<Author>DavidWalker
<Content>After reviewing several on this site Sofitel deservedly came out top After reviewing numerous hotels on tripadvisor my girlfriend and I decided that Sofitel sounded the best in that price range, it came down to this or Paramount in the end. All reviews were accurate and the hotel was certainly above average with helpful staff and modern, clean and roomy surroundings.The location of the hotel was perfect - 2min to the left Times Square and 2min to the right 5th Ave. The room was a decent size with large bathroom but had no view other than fire escapes. Negatives were that we could hear whenever the room next door was running water and there were a lot of door slams.There is a great cafe type place the Red (lobster or flame?) almost next door which is excellent value for breakfasts. Directly adjacent is where the 'worlds most expensive hamburger' is served. One other point is there is a good bar on the same street - St Andrews, if you need to take a break from it.One word of warning is that if you book online directly with the hotel it is does not include tax which will add a significant amount to your bill.Overall a good Marriot type hotel, nothing hugely special but almost nothing to complain about.

<Author>Poppy_9
<Content>A 4 star treat of a hotel in the heart of theatreland Like many others on this site, we booked the Sofitel based upon it's rave reviews on this website...we were not disappointed.From the hustle and bustle of 44th street (the hotel is perfectly placed between Times Square and Fifth Ave) you enter the peaceful haven of french style and comfort which is the Sofitels lobby.The staff were all courteous, from the welcoming receptionists to the discreet maid service and friendly doormen. The location is perfect for exploring the immediate area and is just 5 mins from the subway to get you out to the rest of the city.The rooms are average size and perfectly adequate for two people. Original artwork adorn the walls and the atmosphere created by the furnishings is warm and cosy. The bathrooms offer a greater degree of style with vases of orchids and candles adding the extra touches which make all the difference.As an added bonus the Red Flame diner is just a few doors away is a great place to start the day with a hearty breakfast.We stayed for one week and enjoyed every second, we will definitely stay at the Sofitel again and I can't recommend it highly enough.

<Author>htpartyshack
<Content>What is all the fuss about? I thought it was just okay. Yes, the bathroom was nice and the room was clean, but I don't understand all the rave reviews. I thougt it was just okay. There are much more interesting places to stay in NYC for the same price. Last time I stayed at Le Parker Meridien, and thought it had just the right mix - cool without being impractical, views of Central Park, and great amenities including one of the best gyms in the city, free high speed internet, and a flat screen 32-inch tv and dvd player. But this time I wanted a location a bit further south. I was supposed to have a view of the Chrysler or Empire State buildings, and was told by the desk clerk that the view of the Chrysler is particularly beautiful at night. Well, they must have moved it - our room looked out to a non-descript dreary office building across the street, even though we were on the 18th floor. I could of complained I guess, but I don't go on vacation to argue with desk clerks. The room decor was not in the least interesting, my wife said glorified Holiday Inn upon walking in. It was pretty bland. The staff was friendly and professional, and the soundproofing was great - very quiet for NYC.Sorry to dampen the enthusiasm for this otherwise well-reviewed property.

<Author>b1ggles
<Content>Amazing... My girlfiend and I have been to NYC before, but decided on the Sofitel for a stay for three nights on the 19th February. The hotel did not disappoint. Check-in staff were really friendly, and nothing appeared too much trouble. We never ate in the Gaby restaurant, but the room service food was great and not too expensive. The location is perfect for exploring all the main NY highlights. We never needed to take a taxi anywhere, apart from to/from the airport. Maybe a useful tip, do not take the expensive option of a limo to JFK....we were quoted $45 excl. tip and toll, and a yellow cab with tip and toll cost $35. The Red Flame four doors up the road serves a great breakfast, but it does get very busy later on in the morning. Will definitely use the Sofitel again - the location and five-star standards make it a must. The River Cafe just over the Brooklyn Bridge gives amazing views of the Manhattan skyline, and is a perfect romantic dinner venue (jacket and tie required).

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absolutely Superb! We arrived at the hotel on Feb 13th for a 3 night stay over Valentines Day weekend. Even though check-in was not until the afternoon, when we arrived at 10am we were delighted to find that out that our room was ready and could check in early. First off, let me tell you that this hotel was flat out GEORGOUS. From the sophisticated lobby with marble floor and leather chairs to the glowing candles on every table and the soothing potpurri aroma, we fell in love with the ambiance of this place. Our room was on the 19th floor, and my lord, what a fantastic view of rockafeller center (GE Building). Even though the room was a little smaller than previous hotels i had stayed at in NYC, the overall quality of the room and the view MORE than made up for the size. Everything in the room looked brand new. Even the marble bathroom was in pristine condition. The beds were comfy, slippers and shower robe were provided. Extra pillows and blanket were also already provided in the closet. Location, Location, Location. I dont think this hotel could be in any more of a perfect location (especially when its 15 degrees out). We were literally 1.5 blocks east of Times Square, 0.5 blocks west of 5th Avenue, 5 blocks south of Rockefeller center. EVERYTHING was literally within a 5 minute walk. We couldnt have asked for a better location. To sum it up, this is by far one of the greatest hotels we have ever stayed in. We couldnt have had a more perfect valentines day and a more fantastic trip to NYC. After hours of research on this site and many others, i dont think we could have made a better choice. Last year when i was in the city i stayed at the Rhiga Royal, and while the rooms were huge, i was unimpressed with the lobby, the location, and the view from the room. The sofitel on the other hand was much more agreeable and to my liking. I will be staying at this hotel everytime we go back to the city, it was just amazing. PROS: + Beautiful Lobby + Beautiful Rooms + Extremely Friendly Staff (most seemed to be from France) + Location was superb + Clean Rooms/Bathroom/Lobby + View was fantastic (we were in room 1904 if anyone was curious)CONS: - To be honest, there is none i can think of. It really was THAT good.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sofitel SoRight! Spent AGES reading tripadvisor looking for the right hotel and picked the right one! Spent Valentines weekend there and it was everything the reviews promised - effecient and friendly staff, and with little touches that make the difference; bottled evian every evening with the turndown service, the candle and orchids in the bathroom, the ice machines on every floor - all the small things that make the big difference. The real selling point is the closeness to everything - Times Square one way in less than 5 mins, 5th Avenue 2 mins, Empire State less than 10 mins walk, Central Park in 10 mins.Only thing that made me laugh was the New York born and bred doormen with their daily Bonjour (think Del boy and u get the picture!!) - but then the chain is French.Ate in Gabys once (the in hotel restaurant) which was good but you need to like French cuisine and if you don't, well, alternative venues aren't far!Was able to check in at 11am AND check out at 4pm with no charge (but do ask early)Bad points? Only the mini-bar I guess - $5 for a can of coke is pretty extortionate, but it's a pretty minor complaint when there are so many places to get snacks around. Got a great deal on Expedia so shop around for a good price once u decide to go there.
