<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Faultless. Amazing location, service and comfort My girlfriend and I took our very first vacation to New York between 01-06 January 2004. We chose the Sofitel over other hotels such as the Plaza simply because of the reviews on TripAdvisor.Quite simply the location of this place is amazing. Two minutes out of the door to the right is Times Square and Broadway, two minutes to your left is the famous shopping of 5th Avenue. There are simply loads of places to eat from takeouts to proper sit-down meals. One thing to be aware of is the drinks and food in the actual hotel are a little on the pricey side. A beer will cost you $7. We never ate breakfast at the hotel - There is a diner a few doors down called the Red Flame - Eat here for your breakfast, it's fantastic. Great atmosphere, friendly service and cheap food. For a restaurant recommendation you have to try Triomphe - Its literally next door and offers one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. We ate three courses with wine for about $130.The service and quality of room at this hotel is fantastic value for money. If you need anything William on the door was fantastic. He has a great knowledge of the local area and is always willing to share advice. We never had a problem with the room not being made-up and would not think twice about staying at the Sofitel again. For any tourist that simply wants to do all the sights of New York and literally have them on your doorstep you have to stay at this place.  
<Date>Jan 9, 2004
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice but. . . . We stayed at the Sofitel for four nights including Christmas. I have mixed feelings about my stay. Sofitel-NY is an attractive, well-maintained hotel and is certainly an above-average lodging when compared to other properties in Midtown. The staff is very courteous and professional. The rooms are clean and housekeeping does a very good job. The Fitness Center is great: no extra fee, good equipment and clean at all times of day.I was not overwhelmed by the rest of the hotel. The business center is actually a tiny alcove off of the hotel lobby with only one computer, which malfunctioned on the one day I tried to use it. The rooms are spacious by NY standards but are comparable in size, d茅cor and ambience to a 4-star Marriott or Hyatt. The bathrooms are large and well-appointed, with both a shower stall and a bathtub, but it seems a lot of effort went into the part of the room where the least time is spent. Also, the bathroom doors do not have locks -- even in rooms with two beds -- which can be annoying if you are traveling with someone other than a significant other. The rooms are slight on amenities; there is no VCR or DVD player in the room (although a DVD player was provided upon request at no extra charge) and the TV-Internet runs about US $11.00 for a 24 hour session.The adjoining rooms we requested and received were NOT adjoining. At the Sofitel-NY, the adjoining room configuration is actually two ADJACENT rooms -- across the hallway from each other -- and there is a larger door that separates the remainder of the hallway from the part of the hallway between the adjoining rooms. This is an unusual arrangement, particularly since there is no sound/noise insulation, or deadbolt, on the hallway door. I was very irritated by this because I was assured more than once that the rooms would be ADJOINING. Apparently, in Sofitel-speak, adjoining and adjacent are synonymous. If I'd known this prior to arrival I would have booked elsewhere. I might stay at the Sofitel again, but would never pay more than I did this time (approximately US $180 per night by booking on Sofitel website)  
<Date>Jan 5, 2004
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Pleased We normally stay with family or friends in New York, but have tried sampling city hotels in the past few years.We stayed here for two nights, over New Year's, and agree with every positive post on this forum. This hotel was clean and quiet. The guest room we had overlooked the Chrysler building and the seperate fully equipped fitness center was great- as nice as many we've been to in resort areas.No complaints and believe me, I am a complainer.Loved the decor, loved the location, loved 80% of the staff and don't think it's worth whining about anything, expecially when you get a big, comfy, stylish and modern room in New York in the $200 range Christmas week.I am actively telling family and friends about this property.In general, I would advise that paying the extra $$ in a big city like New York is almost always worth it for comfort. But you really have to read between the lines a bit to make sure you're paying for comfort and not just style. Some of the less expenseive boutique properties on Club Row (West 44th where the hotel is located) are now charging comparable rates for shoe boxes with no amenities.

<Author>haastiff
<Content>Impeccable Quality, Comfort, Service, and Style I travel frequently for my job. I've had the opportunity to stay in some of the best and a few too many of the worst hotels in the US and abroad. I can honestly stay that by far, my experience with the Sofitel in New York is within the top 3 BEST that I've had in the past 3 years. If cleanliness, courteous responsive staff and 5-star restaurants are among the things you look for when selecting a hotel, you will not be disappointed with the Sofitel. This European-style boutique hotel offers crisp, white bed linens and spacious, white-glove-test clean bathrooms. A fabulous restaurant, boutique-moderne, is a couple doors down from the hotel and the concierge actually express-mailed my lost passport to me at my next destination at no cost to me! I will definitely return to the Sofitel and recommend it to family and friends.

I called and returned later that night to find it still had not been entirely made-up but still had plate of peels from welcome fruit basket that should have been removed. Didn't make a fuss as I was leaving next morning. Maybe Sunday shift not up to snuff as rest of the week. Skip the expensive and skinny continental breakfast ($14.00) and join other canny hotel guests from the neighboring Algonquin and Royalton Hotels and go to the Flame diner a few doors down towards 6th Avenue. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Hotel!!!!! We stayed 11/7-11/9. Excellent hotel and location is CHOICE!!!!! 2-3 blocks from Times Square, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Saks, and all the shopping on 5th Avenue. It's located right b/w 5th and 6th Ave. About 4 blocks to most Broadway shows. Empire State Building  Macy's are 9 blocks away (20 min walk). Grand Central Station is about 3 blocks away also. The staff was extremely nice and the room was excellent. The bathroom was very big and had a phone even in the bathroom. I loved this hotel!!!! The employees at the Concierge Desk were very helpful. Especially Chris. We asked where we could get a good steak and he recommended Del Frisco's and even called and made the reservation for us. It was similiar to a Ruth Chris' Steakhouse and had excellent food overlooking Radio City Music Hall (4 blocks away). Staff was great about hailing taxis also. We were going to take a taxi back to JFK when checking out and they offered us a Lincoln Town Car for a $50 flat fee. Taxi would've run $45 so we took that deal. Ended up in a compact black Mercedes and it was a very peaceful ride to the airport. I can't wait to plan my next trip there in Feb and will be reserving again at this hotel.

<Content>Location, Location, Location I surprised my wife with a trip to NYC so she could pick out her own bday gift on Fifth Avenue...okay...I forgot to pick one out myself so this was a quick save my tail manuever. If you are looking to be in the middle of shopping galore, Sofitel is is! Two blocks West is Fifth Avenue and two blocks East is Times Square Tourist Zone. Location is fabulous. You can get anywhere w/o a cab. The Hotel is beautifully decorated in modern furnishings, trimmings, and art. The room is the standard small Manhattan type, but the bathroom more than makes up for it. Huge! All marble, modern decor, stand alone shower , soaking tub...it is great. The lobby is impressive as is the exercise room for a quick pump. Go online and get their Loyalty card a few weeks before going. They will send you a temporary card in the mail. It gets you a 4pm checkout among other things.

<Author>msp22999
<Content>Elegant  Stayed at the Sofitel the weekend of July 26th 2003 and was not disappointed. I arrived very early at about 9:30 a.m. and they allowed me to checkin early! The room was spacious, clean... the bathroom had only a shower because that was all that was available for early checkin, but that was clean and spacious also with good lighting, a magnifying mirror, candle, toiletries... nice BIG SOFT towels... and many of them! the room also came with soft thick terry cloth robes, slippers.. had an iron and ironing board, hairdryer, safe, etc etc! The hallways were clean... and the lobby spacious and comfortable for those who had to wait to check in. Within walking distance of many attractions. I was alone, and felt perfectly comfortable staying here. The room also had great climate control and was QUIET! I usually don't sleep well in hotels, but here I had no problems at all. The only drawback was no view as my room was facing the other bldg, and because of that my cell phone hardly worked, but I'd stay here again in a NY second. Well worth the price!!

<Author>olvrouw
<Content>Perfect for the Weekend Get-Away Not familiar with NY hotels and wanting a memorable weekend to celebrate our tenth anniversary, I researched the theatre district hotel options and one afternoon took a tour of the short-listed hotels, eventually selecting Sofitel. This is a fabulous modern hotel with a decidedly French flair and clientele which seems to cater to vacationers and business travelers. My wife's smile upon entering the room said it all to me.... It has many and varied features and amenities, including a refreshing marble bathroom with separate shower and bath; terry cloth bath robes and slippers. The room we stayed in was spacious with a queen size bed and a view of the Chrysler Building. It was very clean and very quiet. They provide a turn down service that included Evian water and the next day's weather forecast. We were within walking distance of Broadway, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, NY Public Library, St. Patrick's. The staff (front desk, bell hop, door men) were kind, friendly and gracious. The concierge was very helpful - obtaining Sunday brunch reservations on late notice. If you check Sofitel's web site, you can get a free priveleged member card which allows you to stay till 4 on the day of check out. The web site seemed to offer the same lowest rate as the other discount internet providers. It was an amazing, romantic get-away weekend destination, in a perfect location at a great value.
